channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Barriers, 5th September
item.description:
There are random barriers left on Chislehurst High St near the junction with Willow Grove with no apparent reason for them being there! Please can you remove?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Willow Grove, Chislehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Gate open in Tile Kiln Lane N13, 5th September
item.description:
A gate in the fence beside Pymmes Brook seems to have been forced open. It is near the Scout Hut & there are signs that someone has entered the area as the greenery has been trodden down & flattened
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tile Kiln Lane, Bowes, London

item.description:

item.title: Immediate removal needed please, 5th September
item.description:
Hello, Can you please send the correct authority/collection service to remove these cardboard pieces. The local businesses are being severely affected with this unsightly scene. Thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 322, High Holborn, Holborn, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Markings around disabled bay becoming, 5th September
item.description:
D490 designated disabled bay. I contacted you a couple of months ago about the markings fading and at the time you felt it was okay. However , it is becoming more an issue because either drivers are parking in the bay or blocking me in because they don’t see the marking that goes up to the yellow marking. It’s no sense the council being supportive in putting these bays in but not up keeping them to support the disabled to be able to use their bays more effectively and efficiently. Accessibility for the disabled is a must and I know the budget is tight but at the same time. It’s quite stressful when I go to hospital appointments or GP’s appointment or generally go out to comeback to find someone has parked in the bay. Especially elderly drivers are often saying they didn’t see the marking on the road. This is very stressful.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 18, Clifton Villas, Maida Vale, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tyres and other trash in bushes, 5th September
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Howden Close, London

item.title: Traffic cones left behind, 5th September
item.description:
Thames Water was dealing with a sewage blockage last week, but packed up without taking a pile of traffic cones that have not come back for them, and they are sitting outside our house 28 Farleigh Avenue. Please can these be removed? Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Farleigh Avenue, Hayes, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Corner of Maltby Street & Grange Walk, 5th September
item.description:
Not only is this unsightly and disgusting, but it's also dangerous, as it occupies the entire width of the pavement and is located on the corner, near a traffic blind spot, where vehicles occasionally make quick, sharp turns (even though they shouldn't). On top of that, what would happen if somebody with vision or physical impairments had their path encumbered by this? We've asked people nearby (in sight of the eyesore) if they saw who dumped it there. However, no one has any other details, except for very vague descriptions of a van, seen in the area - no number plate or anything. That's a real pity - this person or these people need to return and pick up their mess and be stopped from repeat offending.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Grange Walk, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
